subject: Cybersecurity
title: Conficker: The Worm Nobody Could Kill
description: One-minute skill: Conficker: The Worm Nobody Could Kill.

hook.text: In 2008, a worm infected 15 million computers. A global alliance formed to stop it â€” and failed.

buildup.text: Conficker exploited a Windows flaw, then updated itself, disabled security software, and blocked patches.

discovery.text: It used advanced cryptography to protect its updates â€” the first worm with military-grade self-defense.

twist.text: The Conficker Working Group united Microsoft, ICANN, and researchers. They contained it but never fully stopped it.

climax.text: Conficker proved that sophisticated malware can persist even when the entire industry fights back.

punchline.text: Some worms are harder to kill than to create.

quiz.question: What made Conficker unusually difficult to stop?
options: It used cryptography to protect its own updates
